WorkItem.Description:
I think there's some network timeout that is lagging the app pretty bad when the machine doesn't have a network connection.  
Â 
I'm trying to narrow it down.
WorkItem.Summary: [WPF] Performance w/o network connection is bad

Comments.Message: All icons are pulled from web, that is probably the main reason.
Ahh... Thanks!  I'll look there, see if I can improve the time out or something to help.

LOL... punk!  Here's the use-case, and I wouldn't have even thought about it if I wasn't travelling today working on the model:
I Sync the source before I leave to travel.
While on the plane/in the airport, I don't want to pay for in-flight wifi, but I do want to test the code changes.
Run the build, and watch the performance tank.
Ideal system would be: Icons are attempted to be loaded, asynchronously, and cached locally when they're successfully downloaded. That cache of icons can be released with Rawr.
What Astry said has now been implemented, still working on building the cache to provide with release
